page.title: 13The Village School, Wytham
page.content: None of the 19 children living in the village now go to school there. There is a school and a school house, but no school teachers Both of the buildings are private houses. When it closed in July 1968, there were 13 pupils in the school. Generally parents were in favour of the change,though one mother said, "A village is great for the younger children and preferable to the crowded Botley schools". It cost the Berkshire Education Authority Â£2,400 to run the school; there would be a saving after meeting the cost of transport for each pupil to the school two miles away. It was reported that the village was "running under strength". The farms needed less labour, the cottages couldn't be sold on the open market, there were fewer young families and so the school was no longer viable.
